question: Which of the following is the value of Hubble constant?
option1: 73 kilometers per second per mega parsec
option2: 75 kilometers per second per mega parsec
option3: 77 kilometers per second per mega parsec
option4: 69 kilometers per second per mega parsec
answer: 73 kilometers per second per mega parsec
explanation: The expansion rate of the universe is called the Hubble Constant. Currently the best measured value of the Hubble Constant is about 73 kilometers per second per mega parsec.
